definition: to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But that night she sat on the top of the stairs with her head on her crossed arms and cried.
sentences.chinese: 可是那个晚上，她坐在楼梯口上抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: Two idiots did not have a lot of capacity for liquor crying at the row finally.
sentences.chinese: 没有酒量的两个傻瓜，最后在巷口抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: A quarrel only, with two people cry on each other's shoulder ended a noon.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的一次吵架，以两个人抱头痛哭一中午而告终。

sentences.english: My sister and I held each other with our heads on each other's shoulders sobbing out of control.
sentences.chinese: 我和姐姐抱头痛哭，泪水打湿了彼此的肩膀。

sentences.english: They both cried on each other's shoulder at capital airport.
sentences.chinese: 在首都机场，两个人抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: When I arrived home, Peggotty met me at the door, and we cried miserably in each other' s arms.
sentences.chinese: 我到家时，辟果提在门口迎我，我们俩33抱头痛哭。

definition: to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to bury one's head in one's hands and weep (idiom)
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
tears and mucus flowing profusely/sniveling/in a tragic state
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to shed tears while recounting sth/speaking in a tearful voice
